〈♫〉
our cause maintaind: if that the Lord had not our right sustaind, When
〈♫〉
all the world against vs furi- ously made their vprores, and said wee
〈♫〉
should all dye.

lg.l: Now long agoe,
they had deuour'd vs all,
And swallowed quicke,
for ought that we could deeme,
Such was their rage,
as we might well esteeme.
And as the flouds,
with mightie force doe fall:
So had they now,
our liues euen brought to thrall.
The raging streames,
most proud in roaring noise:
Had long agoe.
ouerwhelmed vs in the deepe.
But loued be God.
Which doth vs safely keepe:
From bloudy teeth,
and their most cruell voice:
Which as a pray,
to eate vs would reioyce,
Euen as a bird,
out of the fowiers gin:
Escapeth away,
right so it fareth with vs:
Broke are their nets,
and we haue scaped thus.
God that made heauen,
and earth as our helpe then
His name hath s • ued vs,
from these wicked 〈◊〉 .

div.head: CANTVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
SVch as in God the Lord doe trust, as Mount Sion shall firmely stand:
〈♫〉
And be remoued at no hand, the Lord will count them right and iust,
〈♫〉
so that they shall be sure for euer to endure.

div.head: MEDIVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
SVch as in God the Lord do •
• ast, as Mount Sion shall firmely stand:
〈♫〉
And be remoued at no hand, the Lord will count them right and iust
〈♫〉
so that they shall be sure for euer to endure.

div.head: TENOR, or Playnsong.
div.p:
☞ 〈♫〉
SVch as in God the Lord doe trust, as Mount Sion shall firmely stand:
☞ 〈♫〉
And be remoued at no hand, the Lord will count them right and iust,
〈♫〉
so that they shall be sure for euer to endure.

div.head: BASSVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
SVch as in God the Lord doe trust, as Mount Sion shall firmely stand:
〈♫〉
And be remoued at no hand, the Lord will count them right and iust,
〈♫〉
so that they shall be sure for euer to endure.

lg.l: As mighty mountaines huge and great,
Ierusalem about doe close:
So will the Lord be vnto those,
Who on his godly will doe wait,
Such are to him so deare,
they neuer need to feare.
For though the righteous try doth he,
By making wicked men his rod:
Lest they through griefe forsake their God
It shall not as their lot still be.
Giue Lord to those thy light,
Whose hearts are true and right:
But as for such as turne aside,
By crooked wayes which they out sought
The Lord will surely bring to nought,
With works most vile they shall abide
But peace with Israell,
For euermore shall dwell.

div.head: CANTVS.
div.l:
〈♫〉
THose that doe put their confidence vpon the Lord our God onely:

〈♫〉
And flye to him for his de- fence in all their need and misery.

div.head: MEDIVS.
div.l:
〈♫〉
THose that doe put their confidence vpon the Lord our God onely:

〈♫〉
And flye to him for his defence in all their need and mise- ry.

div.head: TENOR, or Faburden.
div.l:
☞ 〈♫〉
THose that doe put their confidence vpon the Lord our God only:

〈♫〉
And flye to him for his defence in all their need and misery.

div.head: BASSVS.
div.l:
〈♫〉
THose that doe put their confidence vpon the Lord our God only:

〈♫〉
And flye to him for his defence in all their need and misery.

lg.l: Their faith is sure firme to endure,
Grounded on Christ the corner stone:
Mou'd with none ill, but standeth still
Stedfast like to Mount Sion.
And as about Ierusalem,
The mightie hils doe it compasse:
So that no enemies come to them,
To hurt the towne in any case,
So God indeed in euery neede
His faithfull people doth defend
Standing them by assuredly,
From this time forth world without end,
Right wise and good is our Lord God
And will not suffer certainly
The sinners and vngodlies rod
To tarry vpon his family.
Left they also from God should goe,
Falling to sinne and wickednesse:
O Lord defend, world without end,
Thy Christian flocke through thy goodnes.
O Lord doe good to Christians all,
That stedfast in thy word abide:
Such as willingly from God fall,
And to false doctrine daily slide.
Such will the Lord scatter abroad,
With hypocrites throwne downe to hell
God will them send paines without end,
But Lord grant peace to Israell.
Glory to God the Father of might,
And to the Sonne our Sauiour:
And to the holy Ghost, whose light
Shine in our hearts and vs succour.
That the right way from day to day
We may walke and him glorifie:
With hearts desire, all that are heere
Worship the Lord and say, Amen.

div.head: CANTVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
WHen that the Lord againe his Sion had forth brought from
〈♫〉
bondage great and also seruitude extreame: His worke was such as did
〈♫〉
surmount mans heart and thought. so that we were much like to them
〈♫〉
that vse to dreame▪ Our mouthes were with laughter filled then, and
〈♫〉
eke our tougues did shew vs ioyfull men.

div.head: MEDIVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
WHen that the Lord againe his Sion had forth brought from
〈♫〉

〈♫〉

〈♫〉
eke our tongues did shew vs ioyfull men.

lg.l: The heathen folke
were forced then this to confesse,
How that the Lord▪
for them also great things had done.
But much more we,
and therefore can confesse no lesse,
Wherefore to ioy
we haue good cause as we begun.
O Lord goe forth,
thou canst our bondage end:
As to desa • ts,
the flowing riuers send,
Full true it is,
that they which sow in teares indeed,
A time will come,
when they shall reape with mirth and ioy,
They went and wept,
in bearing of their precious seed,
For that their foes
full oftentimes did them annoy:
But their returne,
with ioy they shall surely see:
Their sheaues home bring,
and not impaired be.

div.head: CANTVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
EXxept the Lord the house doe make, And therunto do set his hand:
〈♫〉
What men doe build it cannot stand. Likewise in vaine men vndertake.
〈♫〉
Cities and holds to watch and ward, Except the Lord be their safeguard.

div.head: MEDIVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
EXcept the Lord the house doe make, And thereunto do set his hand:
〈♫〉
What men doe build it cannot stand. Likewise in vaine men vndertake
〈♫〉
Cities and holds to watch and ward, Except the Lord be their safeguard.

lg.l: Though ye rise early in the morne,
And so at night goe late to bed,
Feeding full hardly with browne bread,
Yet were your labour lost and worne▪
But they whom God doth loue and keepe,
Receiue all things with quiet sleepe.
Therefore marke well, when euer yee see
That men haue heires to enioy their land,
It is the gift of Gods owne hand:
For God himselfe doth multiply,
Of his great liberalitie,
The blessing of posteritie.
And when the children come to age,
they grow in strength and actiuenesse,
In person and in comelinesse▪
So that a shaft shot with courage
Of one that hath a most strong arme,
Flieth not so swift nor doth like harme▪
O well is him that hath his quiu •• ,
Furnish't with such artillery:
For when in perill he shall be,
Such one shall neither shake nor shiuer,
When that he pleadeth before the Iudge
Against his foes that beare him g • udge.

div.head: CANTVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
BLessed art thou that fearest God, and walkest in his way: For
〈♫〉
of thy labour thou shalt eate, happy art thou I say.

div.head: MEDIVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
BBlessed art thou that fearest God, and walkest in his way: For
〈♫〉
of thy labour thou shalt eate, happy art thou I say.

div.head: TENOR, or Playnsong.
div.p:
☞ 〈♫〉
BLessed art thou that fearest God, and walkest in his way: For
〈♫〉
of thy labour thou shalt eate, hap- py art thou I say.

div.head: BASSVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
BLessed art thou that fearest God, and walkest in his way: For
〈♫〉
of thy labour thou shalt eate, happy art thou I say.

lg.l: Like fruitfull Vines on thy house side,
so doth thy wife spring out:
Thy children stand like Oliue plants,
thy table round about.
Thus art thou blest that fe •• est God,
and he shall let thee see
The promised Ierusalem,
and his felicitie▪
Thou shalt thy childrens children see,
to thy great ioyes increase:
And likewise grace on Israel,
prosperitie and peace.

div.head: CANTVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
OFt they, now Israel may say, me from my youth assaild: Oft
〈♫〉
they assaild me from my youth, yet neuer they preuaild.

div.head: MEDIVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
OFt they, now Israel may say, me from my youth assaild: Oft
〈♫〉
they assaild me from my youth yet neuer they preuaild.

div.head: TENOR, or Playnsong.
div.p:
☞ 〈♫〉
OFt they, now Israel may say, me from my youth assaild: Oft
〈♫〉
they assaild me from my youth, yet neuer they preuaild.

div.head: BASSVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
OFt they, now Israel may say, me from my youth assaild: Oft
〈♫〉

lg.l: Vpon my backe the plowers plow'd
and furrowes long did cast:
The righteous Lord hath cut the cords
of wicked foes at last.
They that hate me shall be ashamed
and turned backe also:
And made as grasse vpon the house,
which withereth e • e it grow.
Whereof the mower cannot find,
enough to fill his hand:
Nor he can fill his lap, that goeth
to gleane vpon the land.
Nor passers by pray God on them,
to let his blessing fall:
Nor say, we blesse you in the name
of God the Lord at all.

div.head: CANTVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
LOrd to thee I make my mone when dangers mee oppresse:
〈♫〉
I call, I sigh, plaine and grone, trusting to finde release. Heare now
〈♫〉
O Lord my request, for it is full due time: And let thine eares aye be
〈♫〉
prest vnto this pray- er mine.

div.head: MEDIVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
LOrd to thee I make my mone when dangers me oppresse:
〈♫〉
I call, I sigh, plaine, and grone, trusting to finde release. Heare now
〈♫〉
O Lord my request, for it is full due time: And let thine eares aye be
〈♫〉
prest vnto this pray- er mine.

O Lord my request, for it is full due time: And let thine eares aye be

prest vnto this prayer mine.

O Lord my request, for it is full due time: And let thine eares aye be

lg.l: O Lord our God, if thou waigh
our sinnes and them pe •• se:
Who shall then escape o • say,
I can my selfe excuse?
But Lord thou art mercifull,
and turn'st to vs thy grace:
That we with hearts most • uefu • l▪
should feare before thy face.
In God I put my whole trust,
my soule waiteth on his will:
For his promise is most iust:
and I hope therein still,
My soule to God hath regard,
wishing for him alway:
More then they that watch and ward,
to see the dawning day.
Let Israel then boldly,
in the Lord put his trust:
He is that God of mercy,
that his deliuer must.
For he it is that must saue
Israel from his sinne.
And all such as surely haue
their confidence in him:

div.head: CANTVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
O Lord I am not puft in minde, I haue no scornefull eye: I doe
〈♫〉
not exercise my selfe in things that be too hie.

div.head: MEDIVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
O Lord I am not puft in minde, I haue no scornefull eye: I doe
〈♫〉
not exercise my selfe in things that be too hye.

div.head: TENOR, or Playnsong.
div.p:
☞ 〈♫〉

div.p:

O Lord I am not puft in minde, I haue no scornefull eye; I doe.
〈♫〉

lg.l: But as the child that wained is,
euen from his mothers brest:
So haue I Lord behau'd my selfe,
in silence and in rest.
O Israel t •• st in the Lord,
let him be all thy stay:
From this time forth for euermore,
from age to age for aye.

div.head: CANTVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
RRemember Dauids troubles Lord, how to the Lord he swore,
〈♫〉
and vow'd a vow to Iacobs God, to keepe for euermore. I will not come
〈♫〉
within my house, nor climbe vp to my bed, nor let my temples take their
〈♫〉
rest, or the eyes in my head.

div.head: MEDIVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
REmember Dauids troubles Lord, how to the Lord he swore,
〈♫〉
and vow'd a vow to Iacobs God, to keepe for euermore. I will not come
〈♫〉
within my house, nor climbe vp to my bed, nor let my temples take their
〈♫〉
rest, or the eyes in my head.

div.head: TENOR, or Playnsong.
div.p:
☞ 〈♫〉
REmember Dauids troubles Lord, how to the Lord he swore,
☞ 〈♫〉
and vow'd a vow to Iacobs God, to keepe for euermore, I will not come
〈♫〉
within my house, nor climbe vp to my bed, nor let my temples take their
〈♫〉
rest, or the eyes in my head.

div.head: BASSVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
REmember Dauids troubles Lord, how to the Lord he swore,
〈♫〉
and vow'd a vow to Iacobs God, to keepe for euermore. I will not come

within my house, nor climbe vp to my bed, nor let my temples take their

lg.l: Till I haue found out for the Lord,
a place to sit thereon:
An house for Iacobs God to be
an habitation▪
We heard of it at Ephrata,
there did we heare this sound:
And in the fields and forrests there,
these voices first we found.
We will assay and goe in now,
his tabernacle there:
Before his foot-stoole to fall downe,
vpon our knees in 〈◊〉
Arise O Lord, arise I say,
into thy resting place:
Both thou and the arke of thy strength
the presence of thy grace.
Let all thy Priests be clothed Lord,
with truth and righteousnesse:
Let all thy Saints and holy men,
sing all with ioyfulnesse.
And for thy seruant Dauids sake,
refuse not Lord I say
The face of thine annointed, Lord,
nor turne thy face away.
The Lord to Dauid swore in truth,
and will not shrinke from it:
Saving the fruit of thy body,
vpon thy seat shall sit.
And if thy sonnes my couenant keepe
that I shall learne each one:
Then shall their sonnes for euer sit
vpon thy Princely throne.
The Lord himselfe hath chose Sion,
and loues therein to dwell:
Saying this is my resting place,
I loue and like it well.
And I will blesse with great increase
her victuals euery where:
And I will satisfie with bread,
the needie that be there.
Yea, I will deck and clothe her Priests
with my saluation:
And all her Saints shall sing for ioy
of my protection.
There will I surely make the horn •
of Dauid for to bud:
For I haue there ordain'd for mine
a lanthorne bright and good.
As for his enemies I will cloth •
with shame for euermore:
But I will cause his crowne to shin •
mo • e fresh then heretofore.

div.head: CANTVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
O How happy a thing it is, and ioyfull for to see Brethren to-
〈♫〉
gether fast to hold the band of amitie.

div.head: MEDIVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
O How happy a thing it is and ioyfull for to see▪ Brethren to-
〈♫〉
gether fast to hold the band of amitie.

div.head: TENOR, or Playnsong.
div.p:
☞ 〈♫〉
O How happy a thing it is, and ioyfull for to see Brethren to-
☞ 〈♫〉
gether fast to hold the band of amitie.

div.head: BASSVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
O How happy a thing it is, and ioyfull for to see, Brethren to-
〈♫〉
gether fast to hold the band of amitie.

lg.l: It ealth to minde the sweet perfume,
and that costly ointment:
Which on the Sacrificers head,
by Gods precept was spent.
It wet not Aarons head alone,
but drencht his beard throughout:
And finally it did run downe
his rich attire about.
And as the lower ground doth drinke,
the dew of Hermon hill:
And Sion with her siluer drops,
the fie • ds with fruit doth fill.
Euen so the Lord doth poure on them
his blessings manifold:
Whose hearts & minds without all guile
this knot doe keepe and hold.

div.head: CANTVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
BEhold and haue regard, ye seruants of the Lord: which in his
〈♫〉
house by night doe watch, praise him with one accord.

div.head: MEDIVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
BEhold and haue regard, yee seruants of the Lord: Which in his
〈♫〉
house by night doe watch, praise him with one accord.

div.head: TENOR, or Playnsong.
div.p:
☞ 〈♫〉
BEhold and haue regard ye seruants of the Lord: Which in his
〈♫〉
house by night doe watch, praise him with one accord.

div.head: BASSVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
BEhold and haue regard, ye seruants of the Lord: Which in his
〈♫〉
house by night doe watch, praise him with one accord.

lg.l: • ift vp your hands on hie,
vnto his holy place:
And giue the Lord his praises due,
his benefits embrace.
For why? the Lord who did,
both earth and heauen frame:
Doth Sion blesse, and will conserue
for euermore the same.

div.head: CANTVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
O Praise the Lord praise him, praise, him praise him with one ac-
〈♫〉
cord • O praise him still all ye that be the seruants of the Lord O praise
〈♫〉
him ye that stand and be in the house of the Lord: Ye of his court, and
〈♫〉
of his house, praise him with one accord.

div.head: MEDIVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
O Praise the Lord, praise him, praise him, praise him, with one ac-
〈♫〉
cord: O praise him still all ye that be the seruants of the Lord. O praise
〈♫〉
him ye that stand and be in the house of the Lord, Ye of his court and of
〈♫〉
his house, praise him with one accord.

div.head: TENOR, or • . burden.
div.p:
☞ 〈♫〉
O Praise the Lord, praise him, praise him, praise him, with one ac-
〈♫〉
cord: O praise him still all ye that be the seruants of the Lord O praise
☞ 〈♫〉
him ye that stand and be in the house of the Lord: Ye of his court, and
〈♫〉
of his house, praise him with one accord.

div.head: BASSVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
O Praise the Lord, praise him, praise him, praise him, with one ac-
〈♫〉
cord▪ O praise him still all ye that be the seurants of the Lord O praise
〈♫〉
him ye that stand and be in the house of the Lord, Ye of his court, and of
〈♫〉
his house, praise him with one accord.

lg.l: Praise ye the Lord for he is good,
sing praises to his name:
It is a ••• ely and good thing
alwayes to doe the same.
For why? the Lord hath chose Iacob,
his very owne you see▪
So hath he chosen Israel,
his treasure for to be.
For this I know and am right sure,
the Lord is very great:
He is indeed aboue all Gods,
most easie to intreat.
For whatsoeuer pleased him,
all that full well he wrought:
In heauen, in earth and in the sea,
which he hath fram'd of nought.
He lifts vp clouds euen from the earth
he makes lightnings and raine:
He bringeth forth the winds also,
he made nothing in vaine.
He smote the first borne of each thing
in Egypt that tooke rest:
He spared there no liuing thing,
the man nor yet the beast.
He hath in thee shew'd wonders grea •
O Egypt void of vaunts:
On Pharach thy cursed King,
and his seuere seruants.
He smote then many Nations,
and did great acts and things:
He slue the great and mightiest
and chiefest of their Kings.
Sehon King of the Amorites,
and Og King of Basan:
He slue also the Kingdomes all,
that were of Canaan.
And gaue their land to Israel
an heritage we see:
To Israel his owne people
an heritage to be.
Thy name O Lord shall still endure,
and thy memoriall
Throughout all generations,
that are or euer shall.
The Lord shall surely now auenge
his people all indeed:
And to his seruants he will shew
fauour in time of need.
The Idols of the heathen are made,
in all their coasts and lands:
Of siluer and of gold be they,
the worke euen of mens hands.
They haue their mouthes and cannot speake,
and eyes and haue no sight:
They eke haue eares, and hea • e nothing
their mouthes be breathlesse quite.
Wherefore all they are like to them
that so doe set them forth:
And likewise those that trust in them
or thinke they be ought worth.
O all ye house of Israel,
see that ye praise the Lord:
And ye that be of Aarons house,
praise him with one accord
And ye that be of Leuies house,
praise ye likewise the Lord:
And all that stand in awe of him,
praise him with one accord.
And out of Sion sound his praise,
the great praise of the Lord:
Which dwelleth • n Ierusalem,
praise him with one accord,

div.head: CANTVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
PRaise ye the Lord, for hee is good for his mercy en- dureth for
〈♫〉
euer. Giue praise vnto the God of Gods; for his mercy endureth for euer.
〈♫〉
Giue prayse vnto the Lord of Lords fo • his mer- cy endureth for
〈♫〉
e- uer. Which onely doth great wondrous workes, for his mercy endureth
〈♫〉
for euer.

div.p:
〈♫〉
PRraise ye the Lord, for he is good, for his mercy endureth for
〈♫〉
euer. Giue praise vnto the God of Gods, for his mercy endureth for euer.
〈♫〉

〈♫〉

〈♫〉
for e- uer.

☞ 〈♫〉

〈♫〉
e- uer. Which onely doth great wondrous workes, for his mercy endureth

div.p:

PRaise ye the Lord, for he is good, for his mercy endureth for
〈♫〉

〈♫〉
Giue praise vnto the Lord of Lords for his mercy endureth for
〈♫〉
e- uer. which onely doth great wondrous workes, for his mercy endureth
〈♫〉
for e- uer.

lg.l: Which by his wisdome made the heauen:
for his mercy endureth for euer.
Which on the wa • ers st • etcht the earth
for his mercy endureth for euer.
Which made great lights to 〈◊〉 abroad
for his mercy endureth for euer.
As Sunne to • ule the lightsome day:
for his mercy endureth for euer.
The Moone and stars to guide the night
for his mercy endureth for euer.
Which smote Egypt with their first born
for his mercy endureth for euer.
And Israel brought out from them,
for his mercy endureth for euer.
With mighty hand and stretched a • me,
for his mercy endureth for euer.
Which cut the • ed Sea in two parts
for his mercy endureth for euer,
And Israel may passe there through
for his mercy endureth for euer.
And drowned Pharaoh and his hoast,
for his mercy endureth for euer.
Through wildernesse his people led▪
for his mercy endureth for euer.
He which did smite great mighty Kings
for his mercy endureth for euer.
And which hath slain the mighty Kings
for his mercy endureth for euer.
As Sehon King of Amorites,
for his mercy endureth for euer.
And Og the King of Basan land,
for his mercy endureth for euer.
And gaue their land for heritage,
for his mercy endureth for euer.
Euen to his seruant Israel,
for his mercy endureth for euer.
Remembring vs in base estate,
for his mercy endureth for euer.
And from oppressors rescued vs,
for his mercy endureth for euer.
Which giueth food vnto all flesh,
for his mercie endureth for euer.
Praise ye the God of heauen aboue,
for his mercy endureth for euer.
Giue thankes vnto the Lord of Lords,
for his mercy endureth for euer.

div.head: CANTVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
O Laud the Lord benigne, whose mercies last for aye▪ Giue
〈♫〉
thankes and praises sing To God of Gods I say: For certainely, His mer-
〈♫〉
cies dure, Both firme and sure, Eternal- ly.

div.head: MEDIVS
div.p:
〈♫〉
O Laud the Lord benigne, whose mercies last for aye: Giue
〈♫〉
thanks and prayses sing To God of Gods I say: For certainely, His mer-
〈♫〉
cies dure, Both firme and sure, Eternal- ly.

div.head: TENOR, or Playnsong.
div.p:
☞ 〈♫〉
O Laud the Lord benigne, whose mercies last for aye▪ Giue
☞ 〈♫〉
thanks and prayses sing To God of Gods I say: For certainely, His mer-
〈♫〉
cies dure, Both firme and sure, Eternal-ly.

div.head: BASSVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
O Laud the Lord benigne, whose mercies last for aye: Giue
〈♫〉
thankes and praises sing To God of Gods I say: For certainely, His mer-
〈♫〉
cies dure, both firme and sure, Eternally▪

lg.l: The Lord of Lords prayse ye,
Whose mercies aye doe du • e:
Great wonders onely he
Doth worke by his great power:
For certainly,
His mercies dure:
Both firme and sure,
Eternally.
Which God omnipotent,
By his great wisdome hie:
The heauenly firmament,
Did frame as we doe see.
• or certainly,
His mercies dure:
Both firme and sure.
Eternally.
Yea, he the heauy cha • ge,
Of all the earth did 〈◊〉 :
And on the waters large,
The same he did out fetch:
For certainly, &c.
Great lights he made to vs,
For why? his loue is aye
Such as the Sun We see,
To rule the lightsome day:
For certainly, &c.
And eke the Moone so cleere,
Which shineth in our sight:
And Stars that doe appeare,
To guide the dark • ome night:
For certainly, &c.
With grieuous plagues and sore,
All E • ypt smote he then:
The first borne lesse and more,
He slue of beasts and men:
For certainly, &c.
And from amidst their land,
His Israel forth brought▪
Which he with mighty hand
And stretched a • me hath wrought:
For certainly, &c.
The Sea he cut in two,
Which stood vp like a wall:
And made through it to goe
His chosen children all:
For certainly, &c.
But there he whelmed then,
The proud King Pharao:
With his huge host of men,
And Charrets eke also:
For certainly, &c.
Who led through wildernesse,
His people safe and sound:
And for his loue endlesse
Great Kings he brought to ground:
For certainly, &c.
And slue with puissant hand,
Kings mightie and of fame,
As of Amorites land,
Sehon the King by name:
For certainly, &c.
And Og the Giant large,
Of Basan King also:
Whose land and heritag •
He gaue his people tho:
For certainly, &c.
Euen vnto Israel▪
His seruant deare I say:
He gaue the same to dwell,
And there • bide for aye:
For certainly, &c.
To mind he did vs call,
In our most base degree:
And from oppressors all,
In safetie set vs free:
For certainly, &c.
All flesh on earth ab • oad,
With food he doth fulfill:
Wherefore of heauen the God,
To laud be it your will:
For certainly, &c.

div.head: CANTVS.
div.p:
☞ 〈♫〉
WHen as wee sate in Baby-lon, the Riuers round about:
〈♫〉
and in remembrance of Si- on, the teares for griefe burst out. We
〈♫〉
hang'd our Harps and instruments the Willow t • ees vpon For in
〈♫〉
that place men for their vse had planted ma- ny one.

div.head: MEDIVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
WHen as we sate in Babylon, the Riuers round a- bout:
〈♫〉
and in remembrance of Si- on, the teares for griefe burst out. Wee
〈♫〉
hang'd our Harps and Instruments the Willow trees vp- on: For in
〈♫〉
that place men for their vse had planted many one.

div.head: TENOR, or Playnsong.
div.p:
〈♫〉
WHen as we sate in Babylon▪ the Riuers round about:
☞ 〈♫〉
and in remembrance of Sion, the teares for griefe burst out. Wee
〈♫〉
hang'd our Harps and Instruments the Willow trees vpon▪ For in
〈♫〉
that place men for their vse had planted many one

div.head: BASSVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
WHen as we sate in Ba- by- lon, the Riuers round about▪
〈♫〉
and in remembrance of Sion, the teares for griefe burst out. Wee
〈♫〉
hang'd our Harps and instruments the Willow trees vpon: For in
〈♫〉
that place men for their vse had planted many one.

lg.l: Then they to whom we prisoners were
said to vs tauntingly:
Now let vs heare your Hebrew songs,
and pleasant melodie.
Alas said we who can once frame,
his sorrowfull heart to sing:
The praises of our liuing God,
thus vnder a strange King?
But yet if I Ierusalem,
out of my heart let slide:
Then let my fingers quite forget,
the warbling Harpe to guide.
And let my tongue within my mouth,
be tide for euer fast:
If that I ioy, before I see,
thy full deliuerance past.
Therefore O Lord remember now,
the cursed noise and cry▪
That Edoms sonnes against vs made,
when they raz'd our citie.
Remember Lord their cruell words,
when as with one accord:
They cried on, sacke, and raze their wals,
in despight of the Lord.
Euen so shalt thou O Babilon,
at length to dust be brought:
And happy shall that man be cald,
that our reuenge hath wrought.
Yea blessed shall that man be cald,
that takes thy children • ong:
To dash their bones against hard stones,
which lie the streets among.

div.head: CANTVS.
div.l:
〈♫〉
THee wil I praise with my whole heart, my Lord my God alwayes:

〈♫〉
Euen in the presence of the Gods, I will aduance thy praise.

div.head: MEDIVS.
div.l:
〈♫〉
THee will I praise with my whole heart▪ my Lord my God alwayes:

〈♫〉
Euen in the presence of the Gods I will aduance thy praise:

div.head: TENOR, or Playnsong.
div.l:
☞ 〈♫〉
THee wil I prayse with my whole heart, my Lord my God alwaies:

〈♫〉
Euen in the presence of the Gods I will aduance thy praise.

div.head: BASSVS.
div.l:
〈♫〉
THee will I praise • ith my whole heart, my Lord my God alwayes:

〈♫〉
Euen in the presence of the Gods I will aduance thy praise:

lg.l: Toward thy holy temple I
will looke and worship thee:
And praised with my thankfull mouth
thy holy name shall be.
Euen for thy louing kindnesse sake,
and for thy truth withall:
For thou thy name hast by thy word
aduanced ouer all.
When I did call thou heardest me,
and thou hast made also
The power of increased strength
within my soule to grow.
Yea, all the Kings on earth they shall
giue prayse to thee O Lord:
For they of thy most holy mouth
haue heard the mighty word.
They of the wayes of God the Lord
in singing shall intreat:
Because the glory of the Lord,
it is exceeding great.
The Lord is hie and yet he doth
behold the lowly spirite:
But he contemning knowes afar
the proud and loftie wight.
Although in midst of trouble I
doe walke, yet shall I stand:
Renewed by thee (O my Lord)
thou wilt stretch out thy hand.
Vpon the wrath of all my foes
and saued shall I be:
By thy right hand, the Lord God will
performe his worke to me.
Thy mercy Lord endures for aye,
Lord doe me not forsake:
Forsake me not which am the worke,
which thine owne hand did make.

div.head: CANTVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
O Lord thou hast me tride and knowne, my sitting thou dost know:
〈♫〉
And rising eke, my thoughts afar thou vnderstandst also.

div.head: MEDIVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
O Lord thou hast me tride and knowne, my sitting thou dost know▪
〈♫〉
And rising eke, my thoughts afar thou vnderstandst also.

div.head: TENOR, or Playnsong.
div.p:
☞ 〈♫〉
O Lord thou hast me tride and knowne, my sitting thou dost know:
〈♫〉
And rising eke, my thoughts afar thou vnderstandst also.

div.head: BASSVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
O Lord thou hast me tride and knowne, my sitting thou dost know:
〈♫〉
And rising eke, my thoughts afar thou vnderstandst also.

lg.l: My paths, yea, and my lying downe
thou compassest alwayes:
And by familiar custome art,
acquainted with my wayes.
No word is in my tongue (O Lord)
but knowne it is to thee:
Thou me behind holdst and before,
thou layest thy hand on me.
Too wonderfull aboue my reach
(Lord) is thy cunning skill:
It is so hie that I the same
cannot attaine vntill.
From sight of thy al-seeing sprite
Lord whither shall I goe?
Or whither shall I flie away
thy presence to scape f • o?
To heauen if I mount aloft,
loe, thou art present there:
In hell if I lie downe below,
euen there thou dost appeare.
Yea, let me take the morning wings,
and let me goe and hide
Euen there where at the farthest parts,
where flowing sea doth slide.
Yea, euen thither also shall
thy re • ching hand me guide:
And thy right hand shall hold me fast,
and make me to abide.
Yea▪ if I say, the darknesse shall
yet shroud me from thy sight:
Loe, euen also the darkest night,
about me shall be light.
Yea, darknesse hideth not from the •
but night doth shine as day:
To thee the darknesse and the light
are both alike alway.
For thou possessed hast my raines,
and thou hast couered me:
When I within my mothers wombe
enclosed was by thee.
Thee wil I praise, made fearefully,
and wondrously I am:
Thy workes are maruellous, right well
my soule doth know the same.
My bones they are not hid from thee
although in secret place
I haue beene made, and in the earth
beneath I shaped was.
When I was formlesse then thine eye
saw me, for in thy booke
Was written all, noug • t was before
that after fashion tooke.
The thoughts therefore of thee O God
how deare they are to me?
And of them all, how passing great
the endlesse numbers be?
If I should count them, loe their sum
moe then the sand I see:
And whensoeuer I awake
yet am I still with thee.
The wicked and the bloudie men,
oh, that thou wouldest slay:
Euen those (O God) to whom depart,
depart from me I say.
Euen those of thee O Lord my God,
that speake full wickedly▪
Those that are lifted vp in vaine,
being enemies to thee.
Hate I not them that hate thee Lord,
and that in earnest wise:
Contend I not against them all,
against thee that arise?
I hate them with vnfained hate,
euen as my vtter foes:
Try me (O God) and know my heart,
my thoughts proue and disclose,
Consider Lord if wickednesse
in me there any be:
And in thy way (O Lord my guide)
for euer leade thou me

div.head: CANTVS.
div.l:
〈♫〉
LOrd saue me from the euill man, and from the cruell wight

〈♫〉
Deliuer me, which e- uill doe imagine in their sprite.

div.head: MEDIVS.
div.l:
〈♫〉
LOrd saue me from the euill man, and from the cruell wight

〈♫〉
Deliuer me, which euill doe imagine in their sprite.

div.head: TENOR, or Playnsong.
div.l:
☞ 〈♫〉
LOrd saue me from the e- uill man, and from the cruell wight

〈♫〉
Deliuer me, which euill doe imagine in their sprite.

div.head: BASSVS.
div.l:
〈♫〉
LOrd saue me from the euill man, and from the cruell wight

〈♫〉
Deliuer me, which euill doe imagine in their sprite.

lg.l: Which make on me continu • ll war,
their tongues • oe they haue whet.
Like Serpents, vnderneath their lips
is Adders poyson set.
Keepe me O Lord) from wicked hands
pres • rue me to abide:
Free from the cruell man that meanes
to cause my steps to slide.
The p • oud haue laid a snare for me,
and they haue spread a ne • :
With cords, in my path-wayes, and gins
for me eke haue they set.
Therefore I said vnto the Lord,
thou a • t my God alone:
Heare me O Lord, O heare my voice,
wherewith I pray and • one
O Lord my God thou onely art
the strength that saueth me:
My head in day of battell hath
beene couered still by thee▪
Let not O Lord the wicked haue
the end of his desire:
Per • orme not his ill thought lest he
with pride be set on fire.
Of them that compasse me about,
the chiefest of them all:
Lord let the mischiefe of their l • ps▪
vpon themselues befall.
Let coales fall on them, let him cast
them in consuming flame:
And in the deepe pits, so as they may
not rise out of the same.
For no back-biters shall on earth,
be set in stable plight:
And euill to destruction still
shall haunt the cruell wight.
I know the Lord the afflicted will
reuenge and iudge the poore.
Tht iust shall praise thy name, the iust shall
dwell with thee euermore.

div.head: CANTVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
O Lord vpon thee doe I call, Lord hast thee vnto me: And hearken
〈♫〉
Lord vnto my voyce, when I doe cry to thee. As incense let my prayer
〈♫〉
be directed in thine eyes: and the vp lifting of my hands as
〈♫〉
euening sacrifice.

div.head: MEDIVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
O Lord vpon thee doe I call, Lord hast thee vnto me: And hearken
〈♫〉
Lord vnto my voyce, when I doe cry to thee, As incense let my prayer
〈♫〉
be directed in thine eyes: and the vp lifting of my hands, as
〈♫〉
euening sacrifice.

div.head: TENOR, or Playnsong.
div.p:
☞ 〈♫〉
O Lord vpon thee doe I call, Lord hast thee vnto me: And hearken
〈♫〉
Lord vnto my voyce, when I doe cry to thee. As incense let my prayer:
〈♫〉
be directed in thine eyes: And the vplifting of my hands as
☞ 〈♫〉
euening sacrifice.

div.head: BASSVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
O Lord vpo • thee doe I call, Lord hast thee vnto me▪ And hearken
〈♫〉
Lord vnto my voyce, when I doe cry to the • . As incense let my prayer
〈♫〉
be directed in thine eyes: and the vplifting of my hands, as
〈♫〉
euening sacrifice.

lg.l: My Lord for guiding of my mouth
set thou a watch before:
And also of my mouing lips
O Lord keepe thou the doore.
That I should wicked works commit:
incline thou not my heart:
With ill men of their delicates
Lord let me eat no part.
But let the righteous smite me Lord
for that is good for me:
Let him reproue me, and the same
a precious oyle shall be.
Such smi • ing shall not breake my head,
the time shall shortly fall:
When I shall in their misery
make prayers for them all.
Then when in stony places down •
their Iudges shall be cast:
Then shall they heare my words, for then
they haue a pleasant taste.
Our bones about the graues mouth,
• oe scattered are they found:
As he that heweth wood, or be
that diggeth in the ground.
But O my Lord my God▪ mine eyes
doe looke vp vnto thee:
In thee 〈◊〉 all my trust, let not
my soule forsaken be.
Whith they haue laid to catch me in,
Lord keepe me from the snare:
And from the subtill gins of them,
that wicked workers are.
The wicked into their owne nets
together let them fall:
While I doe by thy helpe escape
the danger of them all.

div.head: CANTVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
BEfore the Lord God with my voyce, I did send out my cry: And
〈♫〉
with my strained voyce vn- to the Lord God prayed I.

div.head: MEDIVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
BEfore the Lord God with my voyce, I did send out my cry: And
〈♫〉
with my strained voyce vnto the Lord God prayed I.

div.head: TENOR, or Playnsong.
div.p:
☞ 〈♫〉
BEfore the Lord God with my voyce, I did send out my cry, And
〈♫〉
with my strained voyce vnto the Lord God prayed I.

div.head: BASSVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
BEfore the Lord God with my voyce, I did send out my cry: And
〈♫〉
with my strained voyce vnto the Lord God prayed I.

lg.l: My meditations in his sight,
to poure I did not spare:
And in the presence of the Lord,
my trouble did declare.
Although perplexed was my spirit,
my path is knowne to thee:
In way where I did walke a snare
they s • ly laid for me.
I lookt and view'd on my right hand,
but none there would me know:
All refuge failed me, and for
my soule none cared tho.
Then cried I Lord to thee, and said,
my hope thou onely art:
Thou in the land of liuing art
my portion and my part.
Hearke to my cry, for I am brought,
full low, deliuer me
From them that doe me persecute,
from the too strong they be.
That I may praise thy name my soule
from prison Lord bring out:
When thou a • t good to me the iust
shall prea • e me round about.

div.head: CANTVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
LOrd heare my prayer, hark the plaint, that I do • make to thee:
〈♫〉
Lord in thy natiue truth, and in thy iustice answere me.

div.head: MEDIVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
LOrd heare my prayer, heark the plaint, that I doe make to thee:
〈♫〉
Lord in thy natiue truth, and in thy iustice answere me.

div.head: TENOR or Playnsong.
div.p:
☞ 〈♫〉
LOrd heare my prayer, heark the plaint, that I doe make to thee:
☞ 〈♫〉
Lord in thy natiue truth, and in thy iustice answere me.

div.head: BASSVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
LOrd heare my prayer, heark the plaint, that I doe make to thee:
〈♫〉
Lord in thy natiue truth, and in thy iustice answere me.

lg.l: In iudgement with thy • eruant Lord,
oh, enter not at all:
For iustified be in thy sight,
not one that liueth shall.
The enemy hath pursu'd my soule▪
my life to ground hath throwne:
And laid me in the darke like them,
that dead are long agone.
Within me in perplexitie,
was mine accombred spirit:
And in m • was my troubled heart,
amazed, and af • right.
Yet I record time past, in all
thy workes I meditate,
Yea, in thy workes I meditate,
that thy hands haue create.
To thee O Lord my God, • oe I
doe stretch my crauing hands:
My soul • desireth after thee,
as doth the 〈◊〉 lands.
Heare me with speed my spirit doth fail •
hide not thy face me fro •
Else shall I be like them that downe
into the pit doe goe.
Let me thy louing kindnesse in
the morning heare and know:
For in thee is my t • ust, shew me
the way that I shall goe.
For I lift vp my soule to thee,
O Lord deluer me:
From all mine enemies, for I
haue hidden me with thee.
Teach me to doe thy will, • or thou,
thou art my God I say:
Let thy good spirit into the land
of mercie me conuay.
For thy names sake with quickning grac •
aliue doe thou me make:
And out of trouble bring my soule,
euen for thy iustice sake.
And for thy mercy slay my foes,
O Lord destroy them all
That doe oppresse my soule, for I
thy seruant am and shall.

div.head: CANTVS.
div.l:
〈♫〉
BLest be the Lord my strength that doth instruct my hands to fight:

〈♫〉
The Lord that doth my fingers frame to battell by his might.

div.head: MEDIVS.
div.l:
〈♫〉
BLest be the Lord my strength that doth instruct my hands to fight:

〈♫〉
The Lord that doth my fingers frame to battell by his might.

div.head: TENOR, or Playnsong.
div.l:
☞ 〈♫〉
BLest be the Lord my strength that doth instruct my hands to fight:

〈♫〉
The Lord that doth my fingers frame to battell by his might.

div.head: BASSVS.
div.l:
〈♫〉
BLest be the Lord my strength that doth instr • ct my hands to fight:

〈♫〉
The Lord that doth my fingers frame to battell by his might.

lg.l: He is my goodnesse, fort and tower,
deliuerer and shield,
In him I trust, my people he
subdues to me to yeeld.
O Lord what thing is man that he
thou holdst so high in price?
Or sonne of man that vpon him,
thou thinkest in this wise?
Man is but like to vanitie,
so 〈◊〉 his dayes to end▪
As fleeting shade, bow downe O Lord
the heauens and descend.
The mountains touch & they shal smoke
cast forth thy lightning flame
And scatter them, thine arrowes shoot,
consume them with the same.
Send downe thy hand euen from aboue
O Lord deliuer me:
Take me from waters great, from hand
of strangers make me free.
Whose subtill mouth of vanity,
and fondnesse doth entreat:
And their right hand, is a right hand,
of falshood and deceit.
A new song I wil sing O God,
and singing will I be,
On Violl and on Instrument,
ten stringed vnto thee.
Euen he it is that onely giues
deliuerance to Kings:
Vnto his seruant Dauid helpe,
from hurtfull sword he brings.
From strangers hand me saue and shield
whose mouthes talke vanitie;
And their right hand, is a right hand
of guile and subtiltie.
That our sonnes may be as the plant,
whom growing youth doth reare:
Our daughters as caru'd corner stones,
like to a pallace faire,
Our garners full and plenty may,
with sundry sorts be found:
Our sheep bring thousands in our streets,
ten thousands may abound.
Our Oxen be to labour strong,
that none doe vs inuade:
There be no goings out, no cry •
within our streets be made:
The people blessed are that with
such blessings are so stor'd:
Yea, blessed all the people are
whose God is God the Lord.

div.head: CANTVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
THee will I laud my God and King, and blesse thy name for aye:
〈♫〉
For euer will I prayse thy name, and blesse thee day by day Great
〈♫〉
is the Lord, most worthy prayse, his greatnesse none can • each: From
〈♫〉
race to race they shall thy works prayse, and thy power preach.

div.head: MEDIVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
THee will I laud my God and King, and blesse thy name for aye:
〈♫〉
For euer will I praise thy name, and blesse thee day by day. Great
〈♫〉
is the Lord, most worthy praise his greatnesse none can • each: From
〈♫〉
race to race they shall thy workes praise, and thy power preach.

div.head: TENOR, or Playnsong.
div.p:
☞ 〈♫〉
THee will I laud my God and King, and blesse thy name for aye:
〈♫〉
For euer will I praise thy name▪ and blesse thee day by day. Great
〈♫〉
is the Lord, most worthy prayse, his greatnesse none can reach: From
〈♫〉
race to race they shall thy workes praise, and thy power preach.

div.head: BASSVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
THee will I laud my God and King, and blesse thy name for aye:
〈♫〉
For euer will I prayse thy name, and blesse thee day by day. Great
〈♫〉
is the Lord, most worthy praise, his greatnesse none can reach: From
〈♫〉
race to race they shall thy workes praise and thy power preach.

lg.l: I of thy glorious maiestie
the beauty will record:
And meditate vpo • thy workes,
most wonderfull O Lord.
And they shall of thy power and of
thy fearefull acts declare:
And I to publish all abroad
thy greatnesse will not spare.
And they into the mention shall
breake of thy goodnesse great:
And I aloud thy righteousnesse
in singing shall repeate.
The Lord our God is gratious,
and mercifull also:
Of great abounding mercy, and
to anger he is slow.
Yea, good to all, and all his workes,
his mercy doth exceed:
Lo, all thy works do praise thee Lord,
and doe thy honour spread.
Thy Saints doe blesse thee, and they do
thy kingdomes glory show:
And blaze thy power to cause the sonnes
of men his power to know.
And of his mightie Kingdome eke,
to spread the glorious praise:
Thy Kingdome Lord a Kingdome is
that doth endure alwayes▪
And thy dominion through each age
endures without decay:
The Lord vpholdeth them that fall,
their sliding he doth stay.
The eyes of all doe wait on thee
thou dost them all relieue:
And thou to each sufficing food
in season due dost giue,
Thou openest thy bounteous hand,
and bounteously dost fill:
All things whatsoeuer doe liue,
with gifts of thy good will.
The Lord is iust in all his wayes,
his workes are holy all:
Neere all he is that call on him,
in truth that on him call.
He the desires which they require
that feare him will fulfill:
And he will heare them when they cry,
and saue them all he will.
The 〈◊〉 preserues all those to him
that beare a louing heart:
But he all them that wicked are
will vtterly subuert.
My thankfull mouth shall gladly speake
the prayses of the Lord▪
All flesh to prayse his holy name
for euer shall accord.

div.head: CANTVS.
div.l:
〈♫〉
MY soule praise thou the Lord alwayes, my God I will confesse:

〈♫〉
While breath and life prolong my dayes, my tongue no time shall cease.

div.head: MEDIVS.
div.l:
〈♫〉
MY soule praise thou the Lord alwayes, my God I will confesse

〈♫〉
While breath and life prolong my dayes, my tongue no time shall cease.

div.head: TENOR or Playnsong.
div.l:
☞ 〈♫〉
MY soule praise thou the Lord alwayes, my God I will confesse:

〈♫〉
While breath and life prolong my dayes, my tongue no time shall cease.

div.head: BASSVS.
div.l:
〈♫〉
MY soule praise thou the Lord alwayes my God I will confesse:

〈♫〉
While breath and life prolong my dayes, my tongue no time shall cease.

lg.l: Trust not in worldly Princes then,
though they abound in wealth:
Nor in the sonnes of mortall men,
in whom there is no health.
For why? their breath doth soone depart,
to earth anone they fall:
And then the counsels of their hea • ts
decay and perish all.
O happy is that man I say,
whom I cobs God doth aide
And he whose hope doth not decay,
but on the Lord is staid.
Which made the earth and waters deepe,
the heauens high withall:
Which doth his word and promise keepe
in truth and euer shall.
With right alwayes he doth proceed,
for such as suffer wrong:
The poore and hungry he doth feed,
and loose the fetters strong.
The Lord doth send the blind their sight
the lame to limbes iestore:
The Lord (I say) doth loue the right,
and iust man euermore.
He doth defend the fatherlesse.
and strangers sad in heart:
And quit the widdow from distresse,
and ill mens wayes subuert.
Thy Lord and God eternally,
O Sion still shall raigne:
In time of all posterity,
for euer to remaine.

div.head: CANTVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
PRaise ye the Lord for it is good vn- to our God to sing: for it is
〈♫〉
pleasant, and to praise it is a comely thing.

div.head: MEDIVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
PRaise ye the Lord, for it is good vn- to our God to sing: for it is
〈♫〉
pleasant, and to praise it is a comely thing.

div.head: TENOR, or Playnsong.
div.p:
☞ 〈♫〉
PRaise ye the Lord, for it is good vn- to our God to sing: for it is
〈♫〉
pleasant, and to prayse it is a comely thing.

div.head: BASSVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
PRaise ye the Lord, for it is good vn- to our God to sing: for it
〈♫〉
is pleasant, and to prayse it is a comely thing.

lg.l: The Lord his owne Ierusalem,
he buildeth vp alone:
And the disperst of Israel
doth • ather into one.
He heal • s the broken in their hea ••
their sorts vp doth he bind:
He counts the number of the Stars,
and names them in their kind.
Great is the Lord, great is his power,
his wisdome infinite.
The Lord relieues the meeke, & throwes
to ground the wicked wight.
Sing vnto God the Lord with prayse,
vnto the Lord reioyce:
And to our God vpon the Harpe,
aduance your singing voice
He couers heauen with clouds, and for
the earth prepareth raine:
And on the mountaines he doth make
the grasse to grow againe.
He giues to beasts their food, and to
young Rauens when they cry.
His pleasure not in strength of horse,
nor in mans legs doth he.
But in all those that feare the Lord,
the Lord hath his delight:
And such as doe attend vpon
his mercies shining light.
O praise the Lord Ierusalem,
thy God O Sion prayse:
For he the bars hath forged strong,
wherewith thy gates he stayes.
Thy children he hath blest in thee,
and in thy borders he▪
Doth settle peace, and with the flower
of wheate he filleth thee.
And his commandement vpon
the earth he sendeth out:
And eke his word with speedy course
doth swiftly run about.
He giueth snow like wooll, hoare frost,
like ashes he doth spread:
Like morsels casts his ice, thereof
the cold who can abide?
He sendeth forth his mighty Word,
and melteth them againe:
His wind he makes to blow, and then
the waters flow amaine.
The doctrine of his holy word,
to Iacob doth he shew:
His statutes and his iudgements he
giues Israel to know.
With euery nation hath he not
so dealt, nor haue they knowne
His •• cret counsels, ye therefore,
prayse ye the Lord alone.

div.head: CANTVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
GIue laud vnto the Lord, from heauen that is so hie: Prayse him
〈♫〉
in deed and word, aboue the star- ry • kye. And also yee, his Angels all,
〈♫〉
armies royall, praise him with glee.

div.head: MEDIVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
GIue laud vnto the Lord, from heauen that is so hie: Praise him
〈♫〉
in deede and word, aboue the star-ry skie. And also yee, his Angels all
〈♫〉
armies royall, praise him with glee.

div.head: TENOR, or Playnsong.
div.p:
☞ 〈♫〉
GIue laude vnto the Lord, from heauen that is so hie: Prayse him
〈♫〉
in deed and word, aboue the starry skie. And also yee, his Angels all,
〈♫〉
armies royall, prayse him with glee.

div.head: BASSVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
GIue laud vnto the Lord, from heauen that is so hie: Praise him
〈♫〉
in deede and word aboue the starry skie. And also yee, his Angels all,
〈♫〉
armies royall, praise him with glee.

lg.l: Prayse him both Moone and Sunne,
which are so cleare and bright▪
The same of you be done▪
Ye glisterings Stars of light.
And eke no lesse,
Ye heauens faire:
And clouds of the aire,
His laud expresse.
For at his word they were
All formed as we see:
At his voice did appeare
All things in their degree:
Which he se • fast,
To them he made
A law and trade
For aye to last.
Extoll and prayse Gods name,
On earth ye Dragons fell,
All deepes doe ye the same,
For it becommeth you well▪
Him magnifie
Fire, Haile, Ice, Snow,
And stormes that blow,
at his decree.
The hils and mountaines all,
And trees that fruitfull are,
The Cedars great and tall
His worthy prayse declare:
Beasts and cattell,
Yea, Bi • ds flying,
And wo • mes creeping
that on earth dwell.
All Kings both more and lesse,
With all their pompous traine,
Princes and all Iudges
That in the wo • ld remaine
Exalt his name.
Yong men and maids,
Old men and babes
Doe ye the same.
For his name shall we proue,
To be most excellent,
Whose praise is far aboue,
The earth and firmament.
For sure he sha • l,
Exalt with blisse:
The horne of his.
And helpe them all.
His Saints all shall forth tell,
His praise and worthinesse:
The children of Israel,
Each one both more and lesse.
And also they,
That with good will:
His words fulfill,
and them obey.

div.head: CANTVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
SIng yee vnto the Lord our God, a new reioycing song: And
〈♫〉
let the praise of him be heard his ho- ly Saints among.

div.head: MEDIVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
SIng yee vnto the Lord our God a new reioycing song And
〈♫〉
let the praise of him be heard his holy Saints among.

div.head: TENOR, or Playnsong.
div.p:
☞ 〈♫〉
SIng ye vnto the Lord our God, a new reioycing song: And
〈♫〉
let the praise of him be heard his holy Saints among.

div.head: BASSVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
SIng yee vnto the Lord our God, a new reioycing song: And
〈♫〉
let the praise of him be heard his holy Saints among.

lg.l: Let Israel re •• yce in him▪
that made him of nothing:
And let the seed of S • on eke,
be ioyfull in their King.
Let them sound praise with voice of flute,
vnto his holy name▪
And with the Timbrell and the Harpe
sing praises of the same.
For why? the Lord his pleasure all
hath in his people set:
And by deliuerance he will raife
the meeke to glory great.
With glory and with honour now,
let all the Saints reioyce.
And now aloud vpon their beds
aduance their singing voice.
And in their mouthes let be the acts
of God the mighty Lord,
And in their hands eke let them beare
a double edged sword.
To plague the heathen and correct
the people with their hands:
To binde their stately Kings in chaines,
their Lords in iron bands.
To execute on them the doome,
that written is before:
This honour all his Saint • shall haue,
praise ye the Lord therefore.

div.head: CANTVS.
div.l:
〈♫〉
YEeld vnto God the mightie Lord praise in his Sanctuary:

〈♫〉
And prayse him in the firmament, that shewes his power on hie.

div.head: MEDIVS.
div.l:
〈♫〉
YEeld vnto God the mightie Lord, praise in his Sanctuarie:

〈♫〉
And praise him in the firmament, that shewes his power on hie.

div.head: TENOR, or Playnsong.
div.l:
☞ 〈♫〉
YEeld vnto God the mightie Lord, praise in his Sanctuary:

〈♫〉
And praise him in the firmament, that shewes his power on hie.

div.head: BASSVS.
div.l:
〈♫〉
YEeld vn- to God the mightie Lord, praise in his Sanctuarie

〈♫〉
And praise him in the firmament▪ that shewes his power on hie.

lg.l: Aduance his name and praise him in
his nughty acts alwayes:
According to his excellency,
of greatnesse giue him praise.
His praises with the Princely noise,
of sounding trumpets blow:
Prayse him vpon the Violl, and
vpon the Harpe also.
Praise him with Timbrel and with Flute,
Organs and Virginals:
With sounding Simbals praise ye him,
praise him with loud Simbals.
What euer hath the benefit
of breathing praise the Lord:
To praise the name of God the Lord
agree with one accord.

div.head: CANTVS.
div.p: Cannon 2. parts in one.

〈♫〉
PRaise the Lord O yee Gentiles all, which hath brought you into his
〈♫〉
light: O praise him all people mortall, as it is most worthie and right.

div.head: MEDIVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
PRaise the Lord O ye Gentiles all, which hath brought you into his
〈♫〉
light: O praise him all people mortall, as it is most worthy and right.

div.head: TENOR, or Playnsong.
div.p:
☞ 〈♫〉
PRaise the Lord O yee Gentiles all which hath brought you into his
〈♫〉
light: O praise him all people mortall, as it is most worthie and right.

div.head: BASSVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
PRaise the Lord O ye Gentiles all, which hath brought you into his
〈♫〉
light: O praise him all people mortall, as it is most worthy and right.

lg.l: For he is full determined,
on vs to poure out his mercy:
And the Lords truth be ye assured,
abideth perpetually.
Glory be to God the Father,
And to Iesus Christ his true sonne:
With the holy Ghost in like manner,
Now and at euery season.

div.head: CANTVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
BEhold now giue heed such as be the Lords seruants faithfull and
〈♫〉
true: Come praise the Lord euery degree, with such songs as to him are due.

div.head: MEDIVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
BEhold now giue heed such as be the Lords seruants faithfull and
〈♫〉
true: Come praise the Lord eue- ry degree, with such songs as to him are due.

div.head: TENOR, or Faburden.
div.p:
☞ 〈♫〉
BEhold now giue heede such as be the Lords seruants faithfull and
〈♫〉
true: Come praise the Lord euery degree, with such songs as to him are due.

div.head: BASSVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
BEhold now giue heede such as be the Lords seruants faith- full and
〈♫〉
true: Come praise the Lord euery degree with such songs as to him are due.

lg.l: O ye that stand in the Lords, house,
Euen in our owne Gods mansion:
Praise ye the Lord so bounteous,
Which worketh our saluation.
Lift vp your hands in his holy place,
Yea, and that in the time of night:
Praise ye the Lord, which giueth all grace
For he is a Lord of great might.
Then shall the Lord out of Sion,
Which made heauen & earth by his power.
Giue to you and your nation,
His blessing, mercy, and fauour.

div.head: CANTVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
ATtend my people and giue eare, of ferly things I will thee tell:
〈♫〉
see that my words in mind thou beare and to my precepts listen well.

div.head: MEDIVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
ATtend my people and giue eare, of ferly things I will thee tell:
〈♫〉
See that my words in minde thou beare, and to my precepts listen well.

div.head: TENOR, or Playnsong.
div.p:
☞ 〈♫〉
ATtend my people and giue eare, of ferly things I will thee tell:
☞ 〈♫〉
See that my words in minde thou beare, and to my precepts listen well.

div.head: BASSVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
ATtend my people and giue eare, of ferly things I will thee tell:
〈♫〉
See that my words in minde thou beare, and to my precepts li- sten well,

lg.l: I am thy soueraigne Lord and God,
Which hath thee brought from carefull thrall
Make thee no Gods on them to call
Nor fa •• ioned forme of any thing▪
In heauen or earth to worship it:
For I thy God by reuen • ing▪
with grieuous plagues this sin will smite,
Take not in vaine his holy name,
Abuse it not after thy will:
〈…〉 blame
And in • is wrath he would thee spill •
The Lord from worke the seuenth day ceast,
And brought all things to perfect end:
So thou and thine that day take rest,
That to • Gods hests ye may attend.
Vnto thy parents honour giue,
As Gods commandements d • e pretend▪
That thou long daies & good maist liue
In earth where God a place doth lend.
Beware of murther and cruell hate.
All •• thy fornication feare.
See thou steale not in any rate,
False witnesse against no man beare.
Thy neighbours house wish not to haue
His wife, or ought that he calth mine:
His field, his Oxe, his Asse, his Slaue,
Or any thing which is not thine.
The spirit of grace 〈◊〉 vs O Lord
To keepe these lawes our hearts restore:
And cause vs all with one accord,
To magnifie thy name therefore.
For of our selues no strength we haue
To keepe these lawes after thy will:
Thy might therefore O Christ we craue
That we in thee may them fulfill.
Lord for thy names sake grant vs this
Thou art our strength O Sauiour Christ
Of thee to speed how should we misse
In whom our treasure doth consist?
To thee for euermore be praise,
With the father in each respect:
And with the holy spirit alwayes,
The comforter of thine elect.

div.head: CANTVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
OVr Father which in heauen art, and mak'st vs all one brotherhood,
〈♫〉
to call vpon thee with one heart, our heauenly Father and our God, graunt
〈♫〉
we pray not with lips alone, but with the hearts deepe sigh and groane.

div.head: MEDIVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
OVr father which in heauen art, and mak'st vs all one brotherhood,
〈♫〉
to call vpon thee with one heart, our heauenly Father and our God, graunt
〈♫〉
we pray not with lips alone, but with the hearts deep sigh and grone.

div.head: TENOR, or Faburden.
div.p:
☞ 〈♫〉
OVr Father which in heauen art, and mak'st vs all one brotherhood,
〈♫〉
to call vpon thee with one heart, our heauenly father and our God▪ graunt
〈♫〉
we pray not with lips alone▪ but with the hearts deepe sigh and grone.

div.head: BASSVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
OVr Father which in heauen art, and mak'st vs all one brotherhood,
〈♫〉
to call vpon thee with one heart, our heauenly Father and our God▪ graunt
〈♫〉
we pray not with lips alone but with the hearts deep sigh and grone.

lg.l: Thy blessed name be sanctified,
Thy holy word might vs inflame,
In holy life for to abide,
To magnifie thy holy name:
From all errors defend and keepe
The little flocke of thy poore sheepe▪
Thy kingdome come euen at this houre,
And henceforth euerlastingly
Thy holy Ghost into vs poure,
With all his gifts most plenteously:
From Sathans rage and filthy band
Defend vs with thy mighty hand.
Thy will be done with diligence,
Like as in heauen in earth also:
In trouble graunt vs patience,
Thee to obey in wealth and woe:
Let not flesh, bloud, or any ill
Preuaile against thy holy will:
Giue vs this day our daily bread,
And all other good gfts of thine:
Keepe vs from war and from bloudshed
Also from sicknesse, dearth and pine:
That we may liue in quietnesse,
Without all greedy carefulnesse.
Forgiue vs our offences all,
Relieue our carefull conscience▪
As we forgiue both great and small,
Which vnto vs haue done offence:
Prepare vs Lord for to serue thee,
In perfect loue and vnitie.
O Lord into temptation
L •• d vs not when the fiend doth rage,
To withstand his inuasion
Giue power and strength to euery age,
Arme and make strong thy feeble host,
With faith and with the holy Ghost.
O Lord from euill deliuer vs▪
The dayes and times are dangero • us:
From euerlasting death saue vs▪
And in our last need comfort vs▪
A blessed end to vs bequeath,
Into thy hands our soules receiue.
For thou O Lord art King of Kings,
And thou hast power ouer all:
Thy glory shineth in all things,
In the wide world vniuersall:
Amen, let • t be done O Lord,
That we haue pray'd with one accord.

div.head: CANTVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
ALl my be •• efe and confidence is in the Lord of might: The
〈♫〉
Father which all things hath made, the day and eke the night. The
〈♫〉
heauens and the firmament, and also many a starre: the earth and all that
〈♫〉
is therein, which passe mans reason farre.

div.head: MEDIVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
ALl my beliefe and confidence is in the Lord of might: The
〈♫〉
Father which all things hath made, the day and eke the night. The
〈♫〉
heauens and the firmament, and also many a starre: the earth and all
〈♫〉
that is therein, which passe mans reason farre.

div.head: TENOR, or Plainsong.
div.p:
☞ 〈♫〉
ALl my beliefe and confidence is in the Lord of might: The
〈♫〉
Father which all things hath made, the day and eke the night. The
〈♫〉
heauens and the firmament, and al- so many a starre the earth and all that
〈♫〉
is therein, which passe mans reason farre.

div.head: BASSVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
ALl my beliefe and confidence is in the Lord of might▪ The
〈♫〉
Father which all things hath made, the day and eke the night: The
〈♫〉
heauens and the firmament, and al- so many a starre: the earth and all
〈♫〉
that is therein, which passe mans reason farre.

lg.l: And in like manner I beleeue,
In Christ our Lord his Sonne:
Coequall with the Deitie,
And man in flesh and bone.
Conceiued by the holy Ghost,
His holy word doth me assure:
And of his mother Mary borne,
Yet shee a Virgin pure.
Because mankind to Satan wa • ,
For sinne in bond and thrall,
He came and offered vp himselfe
To death, to saue vs all.
And suffering most grieuous paine,
Then Pilate being Iudge:
Was crucified on the Cross • ,
And thereat did not grudge▪
And so he died in the flesh,
But quickned in the spirit:
His body then was buried,
As is our vse and right▪
His spirit after this descend
Into the lower parts:
To them that long in darknesse were,
The true light of their hearts.
And in the third day of his death,
He rose to life againe:
To the'nd he might be glorified,
Out of all griefe and paine:
Ascending to the heauens hie,
To sit in glory still.
On Gods right hand his father deer • ,
According to his will.
Vntill the day of iudgement come,
When he shall come againe:
with Angels, power, yet of that day
We all be vncertaine.
To iudge all people righteously,
Whom he hath dearely bought:
The liuing and the dead also.
Which he hath made of nought.
And in the holy spirit of God,
My faith to satisfie:
The third person in Trinitie
Beleeue I stedfastly.
The holy and Catholike Church,
That Gods word doth maintaine?
And holy Scripture doth allow,
Which Satan doth disdaine.
And also I doe trust to haue,
By Iesus Christ his death:
Release and pardon for my sins,
And that onely by faith.
What time all flesh shall use againe
Before the God of might:
And see him with their bodily eyes,
Which now doth giue them light.
And then shall Christ our Sauiour,
The Sheepe and Goats diuide:
And giue life euerlastingly
To those whom he hath tride,
Within his realme celestiall,
In glory for to rest:
With all the holy company,
Of Saints and Angels blest.
Which serue the Lord omnipotent,
Obediently each houre:
To whom be all dominion,
And prayse for euermore.

div.head: A Prayer to the holy Ghost.
CANTVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
COme holy spirit the God of might, comforter of vs all: Teach
〈♫〉
vs to know thy word aright, that we doe neuer fall.

div.head: MEDIVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
CCome holy Spirit the God of might comforter of vs all. Teach
〈♫〉
vs to know thy word aright, that we doe ne- uer fall.

lg.l: O holy Ghost visit our coast,
defend vs with thy shield:
Against all sinne and wickednesse,
Lord help vs winne the field.
Lord keepe our King and his Counsell,
and giue them will and might
To perseuere in thy Gospell,
which can put sinne to • light:
O Lord which giuest thy hol • word,
send Preachers plenteously:
That in the same we may accord,
and therein liue and die.
O holy Spirit direct aright,
the preachers of thy word:
That thou by them maist cut downe sinne
as it were with a sword.
Depart not from those pastors pure,
but aide them at all neede:
Which breake to vs the bread of life,
whereon our soules doe feede.
O Blessed Spirit of truth keepe vs
in peace and vnitie:
Keepe vs from sects and errours all,
and from all Papistry.
Conuert all those that are our foes▪
and bring them to thy light:
That they and we may well agree,
and prayse thee day and night.
O Lord increase our faith in vs,
and loue so to abound:
That man and wife be void of strife,
and neighbours about vs round.
In our time giue thy peace (O Lord)
to nations farre and me:
And teach them all thy holy word,
that we may sing to thee.
All glory to the Trinitie,
that is of mighties most:
The liuing Father and the Sonne,
and eke the holy Ghost.
As it hath beene in all the time,
that hath beene heretofore:
As it is now, and so shall be,
henceforth for euermore.

div.head: CANTVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
GIue peace in these our dayes O Lord, great dangers are now at hand:
〈♫〉
thine enemies with one accord, Christs name in eue- ry land. Seeke to
〈♫〉
deface, roote out and race, thy true right worship indeed: Be thou the
〈♫〉
stay, Lord we thee pray, thou helpst alone in all need.

〈♫〉
de- face, roote out and race, thy true right worship in deed: Be thou the
〈♫〉
stay, Lord we thee pray, thou helpst a- lone in all neede.

lg.l: Giue vs tha • Peace which we doe lack,
Through misbeliefe and 〈◊〉 life:
Thy word to offer thou doest not slacke,
Which we vnkindly gaine striue:
with fi • e and sword,
Thy healthfull word,
Some persecute and oppresse:
Some with the mouth
Confesse the truth,
Without sincere godlinesse.
Giue peace, and vs thy spirit downe send,
With griefe and repentance true
Doe pierce our hearts our liues to amend,
And by faith Christ ren • e,
That feare and dread,
Warre and bloud s •• ed.
Through thy sweet mercie and grace
May from vs slide,
Thy truth may bide,
And shine in euery place.

div.head: CANTVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
O Lord in thee is all my trust, giue are vnto my wofull cry: 〈♫〉
Refuse me not that am vniust, but bowing downe thy heauenly eye.
〈♫〉
Behold how I doe still lament my sinnes, wherein, I doe offend 〈♫〉
O Lord for them shall I be shent, Sith thee to please I doe entend.

lg.l: No no, not so, thy will is bent,
to deale with sinners in thine ire:
But when in heart they shall repent,
thou grantst with speed their iust desire.
To thee therefore still shall I cry,
to wash away my sinfull crime:
Thy bloud O Lord is not yet dry,
but that it may helpe me in time.
Haste thee, O Lord, haste thee I say,
to poure on me the gifts of grace:
That when this life shall fleet away,
in heauen with thee I may haue place.
Where thou dost raigne eternally,
with God▪ which once did downe thee send
Where Angels sing continually,
to thee be prayse world without end.

div.head: MEDIVS.
div.l:
〈♫〉
THe Lord be thanked for his gifts, and mercies euermore,

〈♫〉
That he doth shew vnto his Saints, to him be laud therefore.

div.head: MEDIVS.
div.l:
〈♫〉
THe Lord be thanked for his gifts, and mercies euermore:

〈♫〉
That he doth shew vnto his Saints, to him be laud therefore,

div.l:
☞ 〈♫〉
THe Lord be thanked for his gifts, and mercies euermore,

〈♫〉
That he doth shew vnto his Saints, to him be laud therefore.

div.head: BASSVS.
div.l:
〈♫〉
THe Lord be thanked for his gifts and mercies euermore:

〈♫〉
That he doth shew vnto his Saints, to him be laud therefore.

lg.l: Our tongues cannot so prayse the Lord,
as he doth right deserue:
Our hearts cannot of him so thinke,
as he doth vs preserue.
His benefits they be so great,
to vs that be but sinne:
That at our hands for recompence,
there is no hope to winne,
O sinfull flesh that shouldest haue,
such mercies of the Lord:
Thou doest deserue most worthily,
of him to be abhord,
Nought else but sin and wretchednesse
doth rest within our hearts:
And stubbornly against the Lord,
we daily play our parts.
The Sunne aboue in firmament,
that is to vs a light.
Doth shew it selfe more cleere and pure
then we be in his sight.
The heauens aboue and all therein,
more holy are then we:
They serue the Lord in their estate,
each one in his degree.
They doe not striue for mastership,
nor slacke their office set:
But feare the Lord and doe his will,
hate is to them no let.
Also the earth and all therein,
of God it is in awe:
It doth obserue the Formers will,
by skilfull natures law.
The Sea and all that is therein,
doth bend when God doth beck:
The spirits beneath doe tremble all,
and feare his wrathfull check.
But we 〈◊〉 for whom all those
〈◊〉 made, them for to 〈◊〉 ,
Doe not so know or loue the Lord,
as doth the Oxe or Mule.
A law he gaue for vs to know,
what was his holy will:
He would vs good, but we would not
auoid the thing is ill.
〈◊〉 one of vs that seeketh out
the Lord of life to please:
No • doe the thing that might vs ioyne
to Christ and quiet ease,
Thus are we all his enem ••• ,
we can it not deny:
And he againe of his good will
would not that we should die.
Therefore when remedie was none
to bring vs vnto life:
The Sonne of God our flesh he tooke
to end our mortall strife,
And all the law of God the Lord,
he did it full obay:
And for our sinnes vpon the crosse,
his bloud our debts did pay.
And that we should not yet forget
what good he to vs wrought:
A signe he left our eyes to tell▪
that he our bodies bought.
In Bread and Wine here visible
vnto our eye and taste:
His mercies great thou ma • st record
if that his spirit thou hast.
As once the corne did liue and grow,
and was cut downe with Sithe:
And threshed out with many stripes,
out of the huske to driue.
And as the mill with violence
did teare it out so small:
And make it like to earthly dust
not sparing it at all.
And as the Ouen with fire hot,
did close it vp in heate:
And all this done that I haue said
that it should be our meate.
So was the Lord in his ripe age
cut downe by cruell death:
His soule he gaue to torments great,
and yeelded vp his breath.
Because that he to vs might be
an euerlasting bread:
With much reproch and troubles great
his life on earth he led.
And as the grapes in pleasant time
are pressed very sore:
And plucked downe when they be ripe,
and let to grow no more.
Because the iuyce that in them is
as comfortable drinke:
We should receiue and ioyfull be,
when sorrowes make vs shrinke.
So Christ his bloud out pressed was
with nailes, and eke with speare:
The iuyce whereof doth saue all those
that rightly doe him feare.
And as the cornes by vnitie
into one loafe are knit:
So is the Lord and his whole Chu • rch,
though he in heauen sit.
As many grapes make but one wine,
so should we be but one,
In faith and loue in Christ aboue,
and vnto Christ alone.
Leading a life without all strife,
in quiet rest and peace:
From enuie and from malice both
our hearts and tongues to cease.
Which if we doe then shall we shew
that we his chosen be:
By faith in him to lead a life
as alwayes willed he.
And that we may so doe indeed,
God send vs all his grace:
Then after death we shall be 〈◊〉
with him to haue a place.

div.head: CANTVS.
div.p:
〈♫〉
PReserue vs Lord by thy deere word, from Turke & Pope defend vs Lord:
〈♫〉
which both would thrust out of his throne, Our Lord Iesus Christ thy deere son.

〈♫〉
which both would thrust out of his throne, our Lord Iesus Christ thy dear Sun▪

〈♫〉
